reviews.review:
Still the best Counter Strike game after all these years, one of my favorite online FPS games. With 1.6 being filled with braindead 24/7 dust2 social rejects, and GO a**f****d to the point where it's litteraly unplayable, source is the only game I'd recommend to play if you want to go on a little nostalgia trip about the days of playing the hell out of this with your friends on a late friday evening. Good times. 
The game is still very active, so finding a server won't be a problem, cheaters seem to be very scarce too. The community is kinda edgy, but not in a "xXx_5ùìõùì™ùì®3ùìªùïÉùïÑùîΩùî∏ùïÜ_xXx" kind of way, imagine an old complainy geezer, who forgets what he was talking about each time after about 3 seconds, trust me, even if that sounds a bit annoying, it's one of the more calmer communities (if you stay away from russian servers, that is).
If you want a hardcore, nerve-racking, backbreaking, competative game, then this ain't for you, but if you want a calm little way of passing some time after a hard day of work or school, get this. It ain't Call Of Duty, or Battlefield, or Rainbow Six, it's the good old Valve classic from way back 2004, and let me tell you, it still rocks.
I bought this game for Garry's mod, but I decided to play it anyway. Unfortunately, I didn't think it was very fun (It was pretty bland), but, I can see how this was a huge hit at the time.

A classic PvP shoot'em up game. I've been playing this game off and on for 18 years. You can play just to shoot other people or you can play as a team to take/defend objectives.
Love it classic, CS:GO is trash.
